hero.title: Mama, come home: Can the Philippines bring back its migrant workers?
hero.description: Better salaries have drawn millions of Filipinos to work overseas, but the growing diaspora will be detrimental to the Philippines in the long run.

primary.lead: Dangerously High Heat Index in Parts of the Country
primary.title: Dangerous heat levels affect 11 areas
primary.description: Eleven areas in the country were forecast to experience an “init factor” of 42 degrees Celsius and above yesterday, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) reported.

secondary.title: Heat scorches Metro - Manila Standard
secondary.description: 11 provinces suffer higher temperatures Hundreds of schools across the country, including dozens in Metro Manila, suspended in-person classes on Tuesday due to dangerous levels of heat, with the Department of Health warning against heat-related illnesses such as heat cramps and heat stroke.

secondary.title: Extreme heat affects 2.4 million students nationwide, says DepEd
secondary.description: Over 2.4 million students in more than 4,000 schools nationwide are affected by scorching heat as schools suspend face-to-face classes and shift to alternative delivery modes (ADM), according to the Department of Education (DepEd) on Thursday, April 4.

carousel.title: Top officials with private interests spoil effort to track big fishers
carousel.description: Exclusive: Part 1 | Gamaliel Cordoba, who headed the NTC under Duterte, has a personal stake in commercial fishing because of his family’s business. During his time, the commission stopped issuing service numbers for trackers that would prevent unregulated fishing.

carousel.title: EDSA busway privatization next in DOTr's to do list
carousel.description: After signing the concession agreement for the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA), the Department of Transportation (DOTr) is set to embark on the privatization of another big-ticket infrastructure: the busway in the busiest thoroughfare in Metro Manila.

carousel.description: Tuberculosis has plagued the world for thousands of years and remains a leading cause of death

carousel.title: A double dose of hell: The Bataan Death March and what came next | CNN
carousel.description: On the grounds of an elementary school in a small Philippine village, the fuse was lit on one of the worst war crimes of the 20th century while at the same time setting in motion one of the greatest survival stories in US military history.
